WRITING.TEXT: I don't want it

Her body her choice. However that aside if the guy found out beforehand that he had extremely low sperm count and the unborn child might be his only shot at parenthood, then a serious discussion needs to take place.
What a ridiculous idea.

Its a very difficult thing to overcome. I know because I also overthink everything. As a result it has ruined a lot of relationships. Try to take it one day at a time. Be yourself. Instead of overthinking the negative try to sometimes overthink the positive. Also try to talk to him about it. If by some chance it doesn't work out, that's ok. Don't put that on you. Sometimes that's just the way it is. Although (from what you have written about him) he sounds like he will understand. I hope this helps.
Lil bitch be brave when a guys back is turned huh.
This is why there should be gun restrictions.
Would not care if he's a cop or not. You do that shit to my pregnant wife then I'm going to do everything possible to stop the cop!
Tough little bitch hits from the back like a coward. A least wait for him to turn around.
What little bitch just stands there filming.

WRITING.TITLE: Am I the only one who likes Connor and Xander?
WRITING.TEXT: Sorry first time posting. I understand that Xander and Connor have done things and have issues. But as the title says. Am I the only one who like them?
I like Dawn in the later season.
Connor was ok after the memory alteration. I understood his issues after coming back from the hell dimension.
It was a nice relationship. I can understand why they didn't really reconcile.
Apparently not, lol

Love his character and performance. Happy with his ending. Can understand a lot of his issues and where he comes from. The only thing I didn't like was the Jasmine stuff. I wish they could have explored more with him and gave him an actual redemption arch.
The episode was pretty self explanatory. He feared growing up and becoming like his heavily abused alcoholic father. I would have done the same thing in his position.
Always loved Xander.
What movie or etc is this from?

WRITING.TITLE: Should I give up on being a gentleman?
WRITING.TEXT: Not sure if I should post here, so apologies. Basically I am someone who was taught to hold a door, pull out a chair or let a lady walk through an entrance first,etc. However there have been a few recent situations where I have been told off/berated for doing some of this. Surprisingly about seven time in the last few months. Recently it was a lady getting on to the bus first. I was told off because apparently the only reason a man let's a woman go first is to look at her behind. Or the incident in which I was holding a door and was screamed at for being sexist. (I honestly was just holding the door for everyone (six people, two males include) at that time. She was just the last to enter) I dont seem to get told off by anyone older then a certain age. It seems to be the younger individuals that seem to have an issue and only on an extremely rare occasion someone from an older generation. So should I just stop?
In all honesty. I'd do exactly what Xander did in his position. People need to look at the whole picture. Instead of just from the point of view that they favour.
Salem's Lot.
Absolutely loved them together. Still don't understand how anyone could screw them this badly! Them together =perfection. Really hated the Stiles/Lydia, Scott/Malia ships. Absolutely boring.

WRITING.TITLE: Imagine getting the blame because your girl cheats! Honestly what would you all do in this poor guys situation?

WRITING.TEXT: I was angry and frustrated with the accidental murder reaction and I was especially annoyed and upset about Malia and Scott. I will always put Malia and Stile together in my heart.
Would have loved to have seen this meeting!
I really liked the Xander/Dawn relationship!
